meanings.definition: A type of grape native to the southeastern United States.
meanings.sent1: Muscadines grow well in the warm climate of the South.
meanings.sent2: I picked some ripe muscadines from the vine.
meanings.sent3: The muscadines were so juicy, they made a mess when I squeezed them.
meanings.sent4: The sweetness of muscadines is like a burst of sunshine in your mouth.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of muscadines filled the air, tempting everyone nearby.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the muscadine grape vine.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed a refreshing snack of muscadines on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The muscadines were plump and ready to be eaten.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels in the garden couldn't resist the muscadines hanging from the vine.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was as sweet as the muscadines she savored.
meanings.sent5: The deep purple color of the muscadines was a feast for the eyes.

meanings.definition: A vine that produces muscadine grapes.
meanings.sent1: The muscadines vine climbed up the trellis in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The farmer took great care of the muscadines vine to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got tangled in the muscadines vine while playing.
meanings.sent4: The muscadines vine weaved its way through the garden like a green serpent.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree provided the perfect support for the muscadines vine to thrive.
